thread.title: Young man lands 2nd snowmobile front flip
thread.title_full: Young man lands 2nd snowmobile front flip

title: Young man lands 2nd snowmobile front flip
text:
Young man lands 2nd snowmobile front flip 
By Tara Terregino Young man lands 2nd snowmobile front flip October 20, 2015 Updated Oct 20, 2015 at 4:28 PM CDT 
Grand Rapids, MN (NNCNOW.com) -- A Grand Rapids man is the second athlete to ever land a front flip on his snow mobile, and the first to land the trick more than once. 
For 25–year–old, Tyler Pynnonen, any extreme sport that involves a motor comes naturally to him. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
He grew up riding motocross and BMX but switched gears in 2009 to focus on extreme winter sports. 
"I want to help change the sport and kind of push it to a new level. This was my main goal to actually get this down and achieve it," said Tyler Pynnonen. 
After five years of practicing in between military training, Pynnonen landed a front flip on his snow mobile 30–feet above the dirt last October. 
He has been able to repeat the trick about six times since last year. 
"I originally started doing this on a pedal bike into a lake and that's what led to the whole idea and then I used all the money I saved up in high school and working throughout college and built my own foam pit and started practicing into there," said Pynnonen. 
He says adrenalin was pumping through his body as he drove his snowmobile down a ramp that looks like a wall. 
"I didn't really have any fears I was just mostly hoping that I didn't disappoint everybody that was there watching it," said Pynnonen. 
For those who aspire to compete in extreme freestyle sports, Pynnonen has one piece of advice. 
"Just make sure to follow your dreams and to build your dream because otherwise someone's probably going to hire you to help build theirs." 
Tyler Pynnonen hopes to one day be on ESPN as a top athlete and wants to break the distance jump record and achieve new freestyle tricks.
